lom:description.lom:string: "Discusses the difficulty for women students to experience and hold on to "intrinsic interest" in computer science in an environment that can undercut their confidence, motivation and sense of belonging in the field. The authors assert that confidence issues for women in computer science require and deserve an institutional response of attention, intervention, and remediation. Results were based on a longitudinal study to understand the gender gap in undergraduate computer science." This was an early result of the book "Unlocking the Clubhouse."

lom:title.lom:string: Living among the "programming gods": The nexus of confidence and interest for undergraduate women in computer science
